text.p: -- Goldman Sachs said that although Microsoft Corp remains on its recommended list, it would buy the stock less aggressively for the near-term and would emphasize other client-server software stocks in the recommended group that have performed "less robustly year-to-date."
-- said met with Microsoft's top management last week.
-- said remains long-term bullish on Microsoft's stock.
-- said the stock has been very strong following the March fiscal quarter results.
-- said the stock may need to digest its recent gains and "the valuation may be more of a constraint near-term for the stock."
-- said the near-term constraint "is the absence of new products over the next three to four quarters and likely deceleration of earnings momentum over this period."
